title: Kirsten Dunst is the picture of fall fashion in autumnal plaid shirt and loose blue jeans
text:
She recently said she'd be happy to reprise her role as Torrance (C-Captain Torrance) if the creators of the almost 20-year-old cheer cult classic wanted to make Bring It On sequel.

And, cheery as ever, Kirsten Dunst cut a casual figure in a plaid shirt and jeans on Friday as she was spotted shopping in Los Angeles suburb Studio City.

Dunst, 37, paired the the look with strappy sandals and carried two large brown bags.

Cheery as ever! Kirsten Dunst, 37, cut a casual figure in a plaid shirt and jeans on Friday as she was spotted shopping in Los Angeles suburb Studio City

The Melancholia star had a pep in her step and a smile on her face as cameras caught her walking down the street.

Dunst accessorized with a simple silver necklace, black shades and a black purse while her nails were painted a pretty shade of red.

The actress wore her short blonde locks down in loose waves wand kept her makeup to a minimum.

She earned a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame back in August in honor of a career filled with iconic performances.

Solo shopping trip: The Melancholia star had a pep in her step and a smile on her face as cameras caught her walking down the street

And the Spider-man actress said during an appearance on The Kelly Clarkson Show on last month that she'd be down to bring back one of those iconic performances.

'If [the original creators] wanted to make another [Bring It On], I would make another movie,' she said, adding, 'Why not? It’d be so fun.'

Dunst was just 17 years old when Bring It On was released, and she said nobody expected it to turn into the massive phenomenon that it is.

Made for just $11 million, it stayed at the top of the box office for three weeks, earning a global haul of $90.5 million.

Blondie: The actress wore her short blonde locks down in loose waves wand kept her makeup to a minimum

'We made that movie for no money, zero money,' Dunst said. 'It was a Universal movie, but like one of those that they were like "Go do what you want," like this little cheerleading movie.'

But when opening week rolled around, everyone was shocked.

'It was huge,' she said. That’s always the best — when you don’t expect anything and then it became so huge.'

The film was followed by five straight-to-video sequels - without the original cast - and an adapted Broadway musical in 2011.

Throwback! Dunst was just 17 when the movie came out. Made for just $11 million, it topped the box office for three weeks, earning a global haul of $90.5 million

Dunst is currently starring in the TV series On Becoming A God In Central Florida.

Set in 1992, the Showtime comedy follows a minimum-wage water park employee who lies, schemes and cons her way up the ranks of the cultish, multibillion dollar pyramid scheme that drove her family to ruin.

Off screen, Dunst is engaged to Breaking Bad actor Jesse Plemons, 31.

The duo shares one child together, a 15-month-old boy named Ennis.
description: She recently said she'd be happy to reprise her role as Torrance, C-Captain Torrance, if the creators of the film wanted to make a Bring It On sequel. And Dunst was spotted looking cheery as ever on Friday.
